item.title: 普华永道参议院调查称，澳大利亚应报告所有大型咨询合同
item.description: 由普华永道泄露机密税收计划引发的参议院调查称，澳大利亚政府应被要求披露每一份价值超过 200 万澳元（133 万美元）的咨询合同，合同中应包括要求供应商以公众利益为重的规定。【原文：The Australian government should be required to disclose every consulting contract worth over A$2 million ($1.33 million) and contracts should include a requirement that providers act in the public interest, said a senate inquiry sparked by PwC's leak of secret tax plans.】

item.title: 解说：日本央行的量化紧缩政策会是什么样子？
item.description: 日本央行可能会在周五的政策会议上就其计划如何缩减 5 万亿美元的资产负债表提供指导，缓慢但稳步地退出大规模货币刺激政策。【原文：The Bank of Japan may offer guidance on how it plans to reduce its $5-trillion balance sheet at its policy meeting on Friday, in a slow but steady retreat from its massive monetary stimulus.】

item.title: 日本本田公司将于 10 月开始销售微型电动货车
item.description: 日本汽车制造商本田汽车周四表示，该公司将于今年 10 月开始销售一款微型电动货车，主要面向日本的快递业。【原文：Honda Motor will start selling a micro-sized electric van targeted at Japan's delivery industry in October, the Japanese automaker said on Thursday, joining an increasingly crowded part of the market.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 5 月份就业岗位增加 3.97 万个，失业率降至 4
item.description: 由于企业招聘了更多的全职员工，澳大利亚5月份的就业率超出预期，而失业率则有所下降，这表明劳动力市场在高利率和消费需求疲软的情况下依然保持了弹性。【原文：Australian employment outpaced expectations in May as firms took on more full-time workers, while the jobless rate dipped in a sign the labour market remains resilient to high interest rates and weak consumer demand.】

item.title: 美元因美国通胀降温而下滑；日元在日本央行会议前脆弱不堪
item.description: 周四，亚洲货币兑美元汇率因美国通胀低于预期而走强，但日元除外，在日本央行召开会议之前，日元仍然受到挤压，而且美国政策制定者也表示将在一段时间内维持高利率。【原文：Asian currencies were firm on Thursday against a dollar knocked by softer-than-expected U.S. inflation, save for the yen which remained squeezed ahead of a Bank of Japan meeting and as U.S. policymakers signalled rates would be kept high for a while yet.】

item.title: 美国经济增长令人担忧，原油供应充足，石油价格下跌
item.description: 周三早盘，油价下跌，原因是投资者消化了美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）选择不在近期降息的消息，而美国原油和燃料库存充足进一步拖累了市场。【原文：Oil prices fell in early trade on Wednesday as investors digested news that the U.S. Federal Reserve has opted against cutting interest rates in the near future, while ample U.S. crude and fuel stocks further weighed on the market.】

item.title: 国营媒体报道：中国希望欧盟重新考虑电动汽车关税问题
item.description: 中国国家支持的新华社发表评论称，中国希望欧盟认真重新考虑对中国电动汽车征收关税的问题，不要再朝 "错误的方向 "前进。【原文：China hopes the European Union will seriously reconsider tariffs for Chinese EVs and stop going further in the "wrong direction", according to a commentary in state-backed news Xinhua.】

item.title: 美国东海岸港口工会罢工威胁考验托运人神经
item.description: 美国东海岸和墨西哥湾港口的劳资谈判对零售商、制造商和其他托运人来说是一个迫在眉睫的风险，他们已经在努力应对更长的运输时间和更高的成本。【原文：Labor talks at U.S. ports on the East Coast and Gulf of Mexico are a looming risk for retailers, manufacturers and other shippers already grappling with longer transit times and higher costs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，波音公司在 737 MAX 坠毁后告诉司法部它没有违反协议
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士周三告诉路透社，波音公司在 737 MAX 发生致命坠机事故后告诉美国司法部，它没有违反推迟起诉协议。【原文：Boeing told the U.S. Justice Department it did not violate a deferred prosecution agreement after fatal crashes involving the 737 MAX, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利首席信息官：拜登获胜有利于债券，特朗普更有利于经济增长
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）首席投资官周三表示，如果美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）再次当选，债券市场将可能受益，因为他的政府将努力提高税收以抵消部分政府支出。【原文：Bond markets would likely benefit if U.S. President Joe Biden is re-elected as his administration will try to raise taxes to offset some of the government spending, Morgan Stanley's chief investment officer said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳航将以 1.406 亿美元收购 TripADeal 剩余的 49% 股份
item.description: 澳大利亚澳航（Qantas Airways）周四表示，将以2.11亿澳元（约合1.406亿美元）的价格收购在线旅游企业TripADeal剩余的49%股份，以充分利用假日预订的强劲需求。【原文：Australia's Qantas Airways said on Thursday it will acquire the remaining 49% stake in online travel business TripADeal for A$211 million ($140.6 million) as the airline seeks to capitalize on strong demand for holiday bookings.】

item.title: 三星提出加速交付人工智能芯片的计划
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）表示，其合同制造业务计划为客户提供一站式服务，整合其全球第一的存储芯片、代工和芯片封装服务，以更快地制造出人工智能芯片，从而驾驭人工智能热潮。【原文：Samsung Electronics said its contract manufacturing business plans to offer a one-stop shop for clients to get their AI chips made faster, integrating its global No. 1 memory chip, foundry, and chip packaging services, to harness the AI boom.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行称可采取行动恢复市场 "秩序
item.description: 墨西哥央行行长维多利亚-罗德里格斯（Victoria Rodriguez）周三表示，墨西哥央行正在监控近期国内金融市场（包括外汇市场）的波动，一旦出现 "非典型 "或 "极端 "行为，墨西哥央行可能会采取行动恢复秩序。【原文：The Bank of Mexico is monitoring recent volatility in domestic financial markets, including foreign exchange markets, and could act to restore order in the event of "atypical" or "extreme" behavior, the bank's governor Victoria Rodriguez said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价美国通货紧缩是好事，中国通货紧缩是坏事
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 策略师称，咆哮的凯蒂猫可能已削减 GameStop 期权仓位
item.description: 周三，GameStop 一些短期期权合约的交易量激增，一些市场参与者认为，被称为 "咆哮的凯蒂猫 "的股票影响者基思-吉尔可能已经卖出了他最近披露的该公司的部分期权头寸。【原文：A surge of trading in some short-dated GameStop options contracts on Wednesday suggested to some market participants that Keith Gill, the stock influencer known as Roaring Kitty, may have sold some of his recently-disclosed options position in the company.】

item.title: 摩根大通预计第二季度投资银行业务收入将增长多达 30
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）一位高层管理人员周三表示，摩根大通上调了投资银行业务收入预期，预计在资本市场的推动下，第二季度投资银行业务收入将增长 25% 至 30%。【原文：JPMorgan Chase boosted its outlook for investment banking revenue, forecasting a jump of 25% to 30% in the second quarter fueled by capital markets, a top executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 维珍银河宣布反向股票分割
item.description: 太空旅游公司维珍银河（Virgin Galactic）周三宣布进行 1 对 20 的反向股票分割，导致其股价在盘中下跌 19%。【原文：Space tourism company Virgin Galactic announced a 1-for-20 reverse stock split on Wednesday, sending its shares down 19% in extended trading.】

item.title: 芯片制造商 Broadcom 上调年度收入预期，并公布股票拆分计划
item.description: 科技企业集团博通公司（Broadcom）周三上调了年度营收预期，看好投资人工智能基础设施的企业对其网络设备和定制芯片的更高需求。【原文：Tech conglomerate Broadcom raised its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday, betting on higher demand for its networking equipment and custom chips from businesses investing in artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长称仍可在利率问题上与美联储保持分歧
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）周三在蒙特利尔的一次会议上表示，加拿大央行在降息问题上与美国联邦储备委员会的分歧是有限度的，但加拿大央行远未接近这一限度。【原文：There is a limit to how far the Bank of Canada can diverge from the U.S. Federal Reserve when it comes to cutting rates but the Canadian bank is nowhere near that limit, Governor Tiff Macklem told a Montreal conference on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉股东大会：投资者如何对马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案进行投票
item.description: 在本周四举行的一次重要股东大会上，投资者将就特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）560亿美元的薪酬方案以及公司从特拉华州重新并入德克萨斯州进行投票表决。【原文：Investors will vote on Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56-billion compensation package and the company's reincorporation in Texas, from Delaware, at a consequential shareholder meeting on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局将在 "可预见的未来 "继续加强对波音公司的亲自监督
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）局长将于本周四向美国参议院商务委员会表示，该局将在 "可预见的未来 "继续增加在波音公司及其供应商 Spirit AeroSystems 公司的驻场人员。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration will tell the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee on Thursday that the agency will maintain its increased on-site presence at Boeing and its supplier Spirit AeroSystems "for the foreseeable future."】

item.title: 通过收购，加拿大国家银行向西扩张，分析师称赞其增长潜力
item.description: 分析师和投资者表示，加拿大国民银行从东部向西部扩张，而不是跟随加拿大的大银行南下，这可能有助于确保增长。【原文：Canadian lender National Bank's expansion from east to west, rather than following Canada's big banks south of the border, could help secure growth, analysts and investors said.】

item.title: CalPERS 成为最新一位投票反对马斯克薪酬方案的特斯拉股东
item.description: 美国最大的养老基金首席执行官周三表示，加州公务员退休系统（CalPERS）将投票反对特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）560亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：The California Public Employees' Retirement System (CalPERS) is set to vote against Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion compensation package, the largest U.S. pension fund's CEO said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 索尼影视娱乐公司收购连锁影院 Alamo Drafthouse Cinema
item.description: 索尼影视娱乐公司（SPE）周三表示，已收购美国连锁影院 Alamo Drafthouse Cinema。【原文：Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) has acquired U.S. cinema chain Alamo Drafthouse Cinema, the companies said on Wednesday, a move that will give the studio control over movie distribution.】

item.title: 派拉蒙全球公司称 Skydance 交易不会继续推进
item.description: 派拉蒙公司在路透社周三看到的一份内部备忘录中表示，派拉蒙全球公司与 Skydance Media 的拟议交易不会继续推进，并补充说该公司将继续对探索战略替代方案持开放态度。【原文：Paramount Global's proposed deal with Skydance Media is not moving forward, Paramount said in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday, adding that it will remain open to exploring strategic alternatives.】

item.title: VIEW FOMC 维持利率不变，但缩减 2024 年宽松政策展望
item.description: 美联储周三维持利率稳定，并将开始降息的时间推后至12月，官员们预计今年的降息幅度仅为四分之一个百分点，因为对控制通胀所需的估计不断提高。【原文：The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday and pushed out the start of rate cuts to perhaps as late as December, with officials projecting only a single quarter-percentage-point reduction for the year amid rising estimates for what it will take to keep inflation in check.】

item.title: 美国铁路公司 Amtrak有望在 2024 年打破客运记录
item.description: 美国客运铁路公司 Amtrak 周三表示，尽管运力有所减少，但预计今年的乘客量将首次超过 COVID 2019 前的水平，并创下历史新高。【原文：U.S. passenger railroad Amtrak said on Wednesday it expects ridership to top pre-COVID 2019 levels this year for the first time and reach a record high even though it has less capacity.】

item.title: 美国财政部 5 月份出现 3,470 亿美元赤字
item.description: 美国财政部周三表示，美国政府 5 月份预算赤字为 3,470 亿美元，与去年同期的 2,400 亿美元相比大幅增加，原因是提前支付了 6 月份的部分福利，以及利息、社会保障和国防支出增加。【原文：The U.S. government recorded a $347 billion May budget deficit, up sharply from the $240 billion deficit a year earlier due to the pre-payment of some June benefits and higher outlays for interest, Social Security and defense, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储决策者认为今年仅有一次降息，2025 年将有四次降息
item.description: 美国央行行长们认为，由于通胀率接近 2% 目标的速度比他们预期的要慢，他们今年将只降息一次，比 3 月份的预期少了两次。【原文：U.S. central bankers believe they’ll cut interest rates just once this year, two fewer than they thought in March as inflation approaches their 2% goal more slowly than they had expected.】

item.title: 监督机构告诉美国国会，需要更多消费者数据保护措施
item.description: 美国消费者金融最高监督机构负责人周三呼吁立法者采取更严格的保护措施，防止通过支付处理和所谓的 "现购后付 "服务收集和使用消费者数据。【原文：The head of the top U.S. watchdog agency for consumer finance on Wednesday called on lawmakers to adopt greater protections against the collection and use of consumers' data from payment processing and so-called buy-now-pay-later services.】
